member.name: T:System.Reactive.EventStream
member.summary: Provides the implementation for a reactive extensions event stream, allowing trending and analysis queries to be performed in real-time over the events pushed through the stream.
member.remarks: The interface implemented by this class is provided by the nuget netfx-System.Reactive.EventStream.Interfaces, which must be installed in the same project or one referenced by it.
member.devdoc: The surprisingly simple implementation from the blog post http://kzu.to/srVn3P was surprisingly limiting too :). No support for covariant subscriptions, subscriptions to interfaces implemented by the concrete events, etc. (i.e. the EventPattern<TEventArgs> from Rx wouldn't work).

member.name: T:System.Reactive.IEventStream
member.summary: Provides an observable stream of events that can be used for analysis or real-time handling.

member.name: M:System.Reactive.IEventStream.Push``1(System.Reactive.IEventPattern{``0})
member.summary: Pushes an event to the stream with its sender information, causing any subscriber to be invoked if appropriate.

member.name: T:System.Reactive.IEventPattern`1
member.summary: Represents the Sender and EventArg values of a .NET event.
member.remarks: Exposes a very similar API to Rx EventPattern<TEventArgs> but in a covariant-capable interface, so that subscribers can still subscribe to the pattern but with a more generic base type or interface implemented by the . It also removes the restriction that the argument value has to derive from .

member.summary: Gets the sender value of the event.
